TopicTitle: How much Delta-V in 1 Kerbal EVA?

Articles.Content:
Anyone know how much Delta-V the packs.. pack?

Edited May 22, 2015 by Tobyz28

If I remember correctly, it's about 450 m/s of Delta-V.

Edit: I stand corrected, see below

Edited May 21, 2015 by Jonboy
About 600 mÃ¢Ââ€žs; enough to get into Minmus orbit.

It gives 0.325*g0 acceleration (KER shows), and it uses 0.75 propellant in 30 seconds (my measurement - could contain error), which means 5 propellant available for 200 seconds - and no mass change - that is 200*0.325*g0=637.65 m/s

About 600 mÃ¢Ââ€žs; enough to get into Minmus orbit.

Actually, enough to get into Mun orbit.

If you start from a really tall mountain and define "orbit" as anything that allows you to circle the Mun without more than dragging your toes on the oddcasional hill.

p.s.

It is *also* enough to return to Kerbin from EVE's moon Gilly Potato.

Just don't plan on landing, or anything fancy like that.

Just don't plan on landing, or anything fancy like that.

Actually, landing is no problem. A kerbal on EVA can re-enter Kerbin's atmosphere without any heating problems, and can drop out of the sky into the ocean and survive.

That seems way overpowered to me, and I wish they'd nerf it, but we play the cards we're dealt...
